title: Introduction to Matrices Quiz
description: Basic concepts and definitions of matrices

questions.question: What is a matrix?
options: A rectangular array of numbers arranged in rows and columns
questions.explanation: A matrix is a rectangular array of numbers, symbols, or expressions arranged in rows and columns.

questions.question: How are matrix dimensions denoted?
questions.explanation: Matrix dimensions are written as m×n, where m is the number of rows and n is the number of columns.

questions.question: What is the element in the 2nd row and 3rd column of matrix A called?
questions.explanation: Matrix elements are denoted as a_{ij} where i is the row number and j is the column number.

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a 2×3 matrix?
questions.explanation: A 2×3 matrix has 2 rows and 3 columns, like [1 2 3; 4 5 6].

questions.question: What does the notation m×n represent for a matrix?
questions.explanation: In m×n, m is the number of rows and n is the number of columns.
